job_title: Academic & Career Mentor in Cuthbert, GA
pros: Friendly faculty and staff who share the same vision of helping students succeed in college.
cons: Appears to be no salary increases or COLA.

review_title: A great little place to start at retire from
job_title: Assistant Director, Financial Aid in Cuthbert, GA
pros:
Small campus and you get to know everyone
If you have the drive you have loads of opportunities for cross training 
I received a promotion and pay raise from Admissions to Financial Aid within one year.
Benefits are good overall, full coverage from dental to eye care. 
The F.A. Department is beginning to move towards automation (such a time saver)
cons:
It is a small campus and while it has perks it is also a disadvantage 
Some students get to know staff to well and can get a sense of entitlement

pros: Freedom to teach within the parameters of accreditation requirements, factually student-centered, good support, excellent guidance from president, academic dean, and department directors. Small campus away from distractions that fosters focus on academics and excellent sport programs. The college is about teaching as a passion and does this well.
cons: Adjunct and career salaries are noncompetitive and low.
